abstract: Anne Wojcicki has captured Silicon Valley’s attention with her marriage to a co-founder of Google, and with a biotech company she recently co-founded.
snippet: Anne Wojcicki has captured Silicon Valley’s attention with her marriage to a co-founder of Google, and with a biotech company she recently co-founded.
lead_paragraph: Sometimes good fortune arrives in fairytale-like flurries.

headline.main: Silicon Valley Wide-Eyed Over a Bride
headline.print_headline: Silicon Valley Wide-Eyed Over a Bride

abstract: The F.T.C. has opened an antitrust investigation into Google’s planned $3.1 billion purchase of DoubleClick.
snippet: The F.T.C. has opened an antitrust investigation into Google’s planned $3.1 billion purchase of DoubleClick.
lead_paragraph: The Federal Trade Commission has opened a preliminary antitrust investigation into Google’s planned $3.1 billion purchase of the online advertising company DoubleClick, an industry executive briefed on the agency’s plans said yesterday.

headline.main: Google Deal Said to Bring U.S. Scrutiny
headline.print_headline: Google Deal Said to Bring U.S. Scrutiny

abstract: As competition for top recruits in engineering and other fields intensifies, companies like Google, Microsoft and Yahoo frequently find themselves going after the same candidates, as well as running up against myriad Silicon Valley start-up companies that have been pumped up with venture capital in recent years.
lead_paragraph: As competition for top recruits in engineering and other fields intensifies, companies like Google, Microsoft and Yahoo frequently find themselves going after the same candidates, as well as running up against myriad Silicon Valley start-up companies that have been pumped up with venture capital in recent years.

headline.main: To Lure Top Talent, Google Finds Novel Ways to Recruit

abstract: The Federal Trade Commission has opened a preliminary antitrust investigation into Google‘s planned $3.1 billion purchase of the online advertising company DoubleClick, according to The New York Times.
lead_paragraph: The Federal Trade Commission has opened a preliminary antitrust investigation into Google‘s planned $3.1 billion purchase of the online advertising company DoubleClick, according to The New York Times.

headline.main: Google Deal Said to Bring U.S. Scrutiny
